alert.note: Alert for South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 7:19PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Albany and southwestern Laramie Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 719 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Buford, or 23 miles west of Cheyenne, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... North Crow Campground, Granite Springs Reservoir, Vedauwoo, Granite Springs Campground, Crystal Lake Reservoir, Crystal Lake Campground, Vedauwoo Campground and Buford. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 326 and 344. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
